documents.document:
Unexpected work from home day due to snow. Easy enough thanks to VPNs, ssh, GNU Emacs and Tramp.
Still feels really odd though. I've got very used to working in an office again. (Helps that it's a great building, great surroundings and great people).
IPod doing a great job of "just working", as you'd expect from Apple gear. Who needs correct album art anyway? https://t.co/CGOVEAaIK7

I've set my a…
Screw ups with the shop who sold me it aside... So far I think I can say the Pixel 2 XL is easily they best phone I've ever owned or used. Snappy. Well-behaved. Perfect size and shape.
Popped in in person earlier today. Lots of apologies from the branch manager. Plausible reasons for not being in contact. Offer of compensation is on its way, apparently. https://t.co/BBVKj8I0Ru

Best part of 2½ hours to get home (the long way, collecting child on the way).
I think it's time to head home. 🤔 https://t.co/K9MERBDyVB
Bit snowy around @roslininstitute again. #uksnow EH25 5/10 https://t.co/f21K05ltpE

So far, not so good. Online help seem to think they've dealt with the matter. Store manager promised to get back to me by Tuesday, having admitted the mistake; it's Wednesday. Now being told it's up to me to chase the manager up.
Seriously unimpressed. 😒 https://t.co/NiAmLG8Wak
@igor_chubin I'll take a look at this some time soon. Emacs hacking time is reduced these days thanks to a new job (hacking in Emacs is up, just hacking on it is down), so might be a short while.
Little did @VolcanicArts and I know, one year on, I'd be buying breakfast every morning in a cafe named after her. https://t.co/KAtFO9VebO
Just spent two hours in the lab observing an experiment (to better appreciate data sources). Amazing to watch.

@zorcam I’d imagine https://t.co/y2uBSXfodr would be the place to report the issue, or contribute a fix.

@FrasSmith Thankfully on my primary here. Not checked the GSuite account yet, but I seldom use that these days ‘cos that was for work purposes but I have a work account via the new employer (sadly Office 365).

And don’t even get me started on the shopping list lark, which, last I looked, had been moved into the Home app.
Because of course shopping lists don’t belong in Keep or Tasks.

At first glance I’m liking the new Gmail look. It’s also good to see that Tasks gets higher priority *and* it now has an Android app.
Only…. in typical Google fashion, it seems Tasks, Keep and Reminders are three things that do similar things.
FFS stop it Google!

RT @BarristerSecret: Oh.
